meanings.definition: A sudden, involuntary muscular contraction or convulsive movement.
meanings.sent1: During the exam, he experienced clonuses in his leg, causing him to jump.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with clonuses after observing the muscle spasms.
meanings.sent3: The clonuses in his arm made it look like he was dancing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter sent clonuses through her body, making her shake with joy.
meanings.sent5: The clonuses in his back were so intense, it felt like a mini earthquake inside him.

meanings.sent1: The doctor discussed the clonuses of the patients with the medical students.
meanings.sent2: In the lab, they studied the clonuses of various specimens under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The clonuses of the test tubes on the shelf created a rhythmic sound when they clinked together.
meanings.sent4: The clonuses of the coins in his pocket jingled as he walked down the street.
meanings.sent5: The clonuses of the leaves in the wind sounded like a gentle applause from nature.
